annotation.TEXT: So, what do I do now? Is there a way I can leave this level without dying or using a space-time rewind? Maybe the side exit is enabled?
Now, WhiteYoshiEgg mentioned that there was a secret in Pokey Village, and I did some searching and found it, so I'm going to show that off now.
Zwee!
Huh, apparently there's a slope within this secret passage. Too bad I can't see myself while I'm sliding. Okay, so what if I fall into the hole over here?
Woo, a feather-- Ooh, there's two of them! ...Yeah, I'll take them both. (Hopefully, I won't need that flower later...)
Too bad I can't fly, and I already clobbered that Dry Bones, so I can't take this springboard with me up there, since I need to bounce off of it here.
Ooh, sounds like I'm gonna be getting a cape feather!
Okay, there we go. Now, let's ludicrously speed back over to the right...
I'm guessing this hack just straight-up replaced the turn blocks with these bricks. Good thing I'm super here, or I wouldn't be able to get through!
I wonder if the castle-destruction cutscene will be anything special, assuming there is such a cutscene...

Whoa, what the?! When that 1-up popped out, the game made a star coin appear as well! Maybe the "checkpoint 1-up found" value is also used by star coins in this hack. However, that star coin wasn't actually added to my total for some reason...
Hello, and welcome back to Pokey's Adventure! So, where to next? Cape Caverns, or Switch Oasis? Well, let's take a look at the votes...
Alright, it's boss time!
So, I'm not trapped down there either, unlike that Cape Caverns room.
BGM: Pok√©mon Snap - Professor Oak's Check
Yeah, I thought I was about due for another multi-coin block.
Yeah, that seemed like an obvious multi-coin block to me.
The cape is obviously needed to reach that P coin. (Actually, the nearby Chuck could tear down the wall as well.)

Argh, that's annoying when that happens. I expected to bounce off of that enemy while spin jumping with the cape, and the game instead decided that I thwacked the enemy before bouncing off of it. Result: OMNOMNOM.

Well, I do believe I'm done with this hack now, unless I missed something. I hope you all enjoyed watching me play through what little there was of Pokey's Adventure! WhiteYoshiEgg, if you ever decide to continue working on this hack, let me know!
There's also that passage up there, which looks like it requires the Green Switch Palace to be hit. However, I bet I can get up there with a bit of tool-assistance, a wall jump, and a shell jump!
Also, there's this brick wall that I need a cape or a koopa shell to get past, which has more coins and a 1-up behind it.
I hope I didn't accidentally overlook any votes this time...
Nope, and I doubt I can Start+Select out...
Can I get out of here by jumping back up this way? ...Yes I can!
Huh. Seems like there's a ceiling above the screen here, so I can't try anything funny involving going above the level.
Oh, well. At least I can Start+Select out.
Hmm... Actually, I want to keep my spare flower for something that I'm sure will be coming up later.
Oh, right. I can't fly. Also, nice background there. The graphics remind me of the old Atari and Intellivision systems for some reason.
That Jake got thwacked.
Sure, why not?
Whoa, man. You definitely need the gliding power of the cape to reach that P coin.

Yeah, that's definitely not where the music is supposed to loop. If you click on this annotation and listen to the linked video, you'll hear more of the song after about the 1:05 mark, which is about where the song erroneously loops in this hack.
DOUBLE KILL!
Ow, my thorns!
Space-time rewind count: 1
Sweet! Fortunately, it didn't take long for me to get that wall jump to work, and from there, the shell jump was easy!
DOUBLE KILL!

(Actually, looking back, I think it would've been faster if I kept going to the right. I believe there was a much closer block with a cape that way. In addition, I could've had a Chuck break those bricks for me, but I didn't think of it at the time.)
...and assuming that the game doesn't just lock up here... GAAAMMMEEE!!! (Well, it's probably more like a soft-lock, since the lava's animation is still going.)
Up next would be The First Tower, but first, I still want to see what's beyond those flammable/inflammable blocks in Cape Caverns. So, let's go somewhere else for a flower real quick...
Wow, I sucked big time on that multi-coin block. I blame the Chuck for interrupting me.
Well, if I don't find a flower anywhere in this level, I'll get a flower from elsewhere and then come back here.
I think "hitting" should be changed to "hit" here.
So, making it up there got me a bunch of coins and an invisible 1-up. Well, this place was way more interesting than that Cape Caverns room.
I wonder if there was meant to be something special here that just hasn't been implemented into the hack yet...
Okay, so by cape gliding, I was able to take the lower route down there, which allowed me to reveal this vine, and reach this P coin up here.
DOUBLE KILL!
Okay, hopefully this will be an actual complete level.
Um, what? Well, these look like Map16 tiles that haven't been edited yet. So, what were these tiles supposed to be?
Ugh, that badly-looping music is driving me nuts now.
And, what happened over here? Umm... I have the distinct feeling that this level is incomplete.

Oh, and even worse, I'm at my destination with the flower, but with no way to enter the pipe without a cape. Alright, I've gotta backtrack and look for a cape that I haven't collected yet. And hopefully, I won't lose the flower along the way...
I think I'm supposed to jump into that pit, if that sign is anything to go by, but first, what's to the right?
The blocks that the maces are connected to look neat. Also, too bad the switch level was a mirage, so I'll have to make do without any ! blocks... not that I need a mushroom anyway.
Ow, my glochids! That was poor judgment on my part.
Umm... That's it? Just a few coins, and a platform that's obviously meant to have something special resting on it...
Alright, I'm TAS-ing now.
Cape gliding is probably the only way to get that P coin without getting OMNOMNOM-ed. And with that, I've gotten all of the P coins in this level!
There were enough coins for me to reach the 1000 mark!
Alright, it's got a duder, so that automatically makes it more interesting than that Cape Caverns room.
And that's it for Morton! Staples: "That was easy."
Well, that was disappointing. Sorry folks, but I didn't know that Switch Oasis was gonna be a mirage when I held the vote. Oh, well. Let's go to Cape Caverns now.
There's a hidden 1-up, which I knew was there.
There's the goal, but is there anything to the right of it?
Ah, it leads to a new area. Now, wye said this secret would be underwhelming, but maybe it'll at least be more interesting than that secret room in Cape Caverns.
Oh, right. Pokey can't fly like Mario can, so he can't reach that opening in the ceiling there.
Looks like there's a pipe down there that requires cape powers (or a Chuck) to reach.
No Yoshis because they've been ordered to trim the glitchy graphics off of that bush.
Whoops, I caught on the ? block wall there, which sorta screwed up the spin jump I was doing.
BURN! BURN TO THE GROUND! BURN! BURN TO THE GROUND! BURN TO THE GROUND! TRI-FORMATION! WOO!
Well, at least there's a replacement cape right there. (Aw, why couldn't it be a flower? Probably because this is "Cape Caverns".)
Now, notice how far I can scroll the screen to the right... Yep, there's a secret passage there which I can go through by jumping into this wall.
So, what's over here? Doesn't look like much...
Alright, I'm somewhere new. I wonder if there'll be a special prize like a moon down here...
No cape there. Just a multi-coin block that I don't care about now.
WhiteYoshiEgg, did you happen to insert a faulty version of this song into this hack or something?

I still wonder why Thwomps that are off the top of the screen drop immediately instead of waiting for me to get close to them... Maybe Nintendo made them do that on purpose so that players wouldn't be unfairly surprised by them.
Whatever. I have both a flower and a cape now, so let's ludicrously speed through Cape Caverns again...
GAAAMMMEEE!!! Argh, I actually did need to hang on to my Fire Flower all this way, and I haven't seen a single flower in this level. Only capes.
...Yeah, it's still pretty easy. Alright, the boss door's right there, and if it's who I think it is, then I'll want to switch to my flower before entering the boss room...
Alright, that secret was pretty much a bust. Let's check out The First Tower now.
Also, there's a Jake, who's actually shell-killable this time.
First, enter this house...
I definitely want to keep collecting coins. Who knows how much I'll want to have when I finally reach a shop.
Ah, there was a P coin. Alright, time for Pokey to fall down the hole.
Alright, I'm heading to Switch Oasis!
...Oh, I can! Okay!
DOUBLE KILL!
Aw, nuts. Since I haven't been to any non-mirage switch palaces, this part gets slightly harder, since I don't have an ! block to guard me from falling down one of these pits.
GAAAMMMEEE!!!
And, there's another hidden 1-up just up ahead...
Yep, it's Morton, as I thought, so this'll be over before this annotation disappears.
Oh, and I can't even leave the way I came in! Perhaps whatever was meant to be here would've automatically cleared the level as well. Maybe a secret exit was intended to be placed here eventually.
Anything behind me? Nope. Alright.
There's another feather, which appears to only be obtainable if you're already caped, so it would only be useful if you needed a reserve cape.
And... That's it. I'm guessing there is meant to be another special thing here like in that Cape Caverns room, but again, it's not implemented into the hack yet.
Aw, it doesn't look like Pokey can actually fly, so I can only glide and cape thwack stuff.
Alright, so there's no custom music, and we've got Thwimps dropping from the ceiling. Hmm... I'm getting a sorta Morton-like vibe from this place for some reason.
DOUBLE KILL!

...Uh, what? Did the music just loop weirdly? I've heard this custom song in many other hacks, and I don't think it normally loops there. What could cause a custom song to loop improperly like this, anyway?
Alright, now let's see what's beyond those flammable/inflammable blocks...
Well, that sucks, and no button inputs were doing anything, so I guess that's the end of the hack for now. However, I'm not quite done with this video yet...
Game crash (?) count: 1
I wonder why there's this row of dotted green blocks here...
Huh, no fade out or time bonus calculation. Well, that kinda makes sense, since there are no time limits in this hack.
